name: src/constants/AbortReasons.js
TOO_MANY_FAILED_PIN_ATTEMPTS
description: When the user tried too much on an invalid pin

name: WITHDRAW_LIMIT_REACHED
description: When the user failed to withdraw due to the withdraw limit

name: NOT_ENOUGH_FUNDS
description: When the user asked more than it had

name: USER_CANCELS
description: When the user cancels on its own

name: src/constants/ActionTypes.js
CARD_INSERTED
description: The card has been inserted by the user

name: CARD_PROCESSED
description: The card has been processed by the ATM

name: PIN_INSERTED
description: The pin has been inserted by the user

name: PIN_PROCESSED_VALID
description: The pin is valid

name: PIN_PROCESSED_INVALID
description: The pin is invalid

name: WITHDRAW
description: withdraw some money

name: WITHDRAW_SUSCESFUL
description: withdraw was suscesful

name: MONEY_DELIVERED
description: money has been delivered

name: CARD_AND_MONEY_TAKEN
description: The user took his card and money

name: FINISHED
description: Process finished

name: PERFORM_ABORT
description: Trigger an abort

name: COMPLETE_ABORT
description: Abort has been completed

name: src/constants/States.js
WAITING_FOR_CARD
description: The ATM is waiting for the card

name: PROCESSING_CARD
description: The ATM is processing the card

name: WAITING_FOR_PIN
description: The ATM is waiting for the pin to be inserted

name: PROCESSING_PIN
description: The ATM is processing the pin

name: WAITING_FOR_AMOUNT
description: The ATM is waiting for the amount to be set

name: PROCESSING_AMOUNT
description: The ATM is processing the amount

name: DELIVERING
description: The ATM is delivering the money

name: DELIVERED
description: The ATM has delivered the money

name: DONE
description: The ATM is done with the process and will restart

name: ABORTING
description: The ATM is aborting

name: src/constants/config.js
MAX_PIN_TRIES
description: The maximum times you can retry to input the pin

name: RIGHT_PIN
description: Right pin number

name: FUNDS
description: The funds of the user

name: WITHDRAW_LIMIT
description: The limit of the transaction size for this account

name: src/containers/App.js
App
description:
This is the main application class that controls all the components that render a specific view
It uses the state out of the store in order to render the view

name: render
description: Render function

name: src/controllers/Aborting.js
AbortingController
description: This is the controller class that will handle the aborting operation

name: render
description: Render function

name: src/controllers/Delivered.js
DeliveredController
description:
This is the controller class that handles such
Once the user gives the input it will trigger the card and money taken action

name: render
description: Render function

name: src/controllers/Delivering.js
DeliveringController
description:
This is the controller class that handles such
It's a dummy controller and just waits two second to consider it delivered

name: componentDidMount
description: Waits 2 seconds before setting the state to devivered

name: render
description: Render function

name: src/controllers/Done.js
DoneController
description:
This is the controller class that handles such
It just shows itself for two seconds before finishing

name: componentDidMount
description: Waits 2 seconds before restarting by triggering the finished event

name: render
description: Render function

name: src/controllers/ProcessingAmount.js
ProcessingAmountController
description:
This is the controller that processes the amount
Because it's a dummy controller it only waits after a specific timeout
It takes the withdraw limit and launchs an abort screen in case it surpasses it
Otherwise it checks against the funds and sends a message regarding that

name: constructor
description: React constructor

name: timeout
description: Contains the timeout variable

name: componentDidMount
description: Waits 2 seconds before performing the action regarding the funds as well as the limit

name: abort
description: Performs the abort and cancels the waiting operation

name: render
description: Render function

name: src/controllers/ProcessingCard.js
ProcessingCardController
description:
This is the controller that processes the card operation
Because it's a dummy controller it only waits after a specific timeout

name: componentDidMount
description: Waits 2 seconds before setting into card processed state

name: render
description: Render function

name: src/controllers/ProcessingPin.js
ProcessingPinController
description:
This is the controller that processes the pin operation
Because it's a dummy controller it only waits after a specific timeout
The only valid pin is 1234

name: constructor
description: React constructor

name: timeout
description: Contains the timeout variable

name: componentDidMount
description:
Waits 2 seconds before setting into valid or invalid state
It can also abort if done too many times

name: abort
description: Performs the abort and cancels the waiting operation

name: render
description: Render function

name: src/controllers/WaitingForAmount.js
WaitingForAmountController
description:
Waits for the amount to be input in order to trigger the action
to get a specific amount of money

name: render
description: Render function

WaitingForCardController
description: This is the controller class that handles such

name: render

WaitingForPinController

abortReason

name: src/reducers/amount.js
amount
description:
This is the state reducer that represents the current amount that was used in the ATM
the value is held until the operation is over or rolled back

params.name: state
params.description: The current state, as provided by the store

name: src/reducers/index.js
rootReducer
description: This is the root reducer that will populate the store

name: src/reducers/pin.js
pin
description:
This is the state reducer that represents the current pin that was
set into the ATM and it holded only for a brief time until is valid or invalid

params.name: state
params.description: The current state, as provided by the store

name: src/reducers/pinAttempts.js
pinAttempts
description:
This is the main state reducer and represents the amount of times the user
has attempted to put a pin in the ATM
The number will reset once the ATM finishes or aborts

params.name: state
params.description: The current state, as provided by the store

name: src/reducers/state.js
state
description:
This is the main state reducer and represents the main state of the application
it represents in which situation the ATM is

params.name: state
params.description: The current state, as provided by the store
